oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from John Sloan to Rt. Rev. E. P. Dandridge
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter dated May 18, 1960 thanking Rt. Rev. E. P. Dandridge for his letter of May 16, 1960. He describes the reaction to the decision that was made to integrate the Cain-Sloan Department Store lunch counters.
John Sloan was president of the Cain-Sloan Company. The firm opened its first new $12,000,000 department store in downtown Nashville, Tennessee on October 25, 1957.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sloan, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civil rights demonstrations; Civil rights demonstrations - Tennessee - Nashville; African Americans - Civil rights - Tennessee - Nashville; Sit-ins (Civil rights); Civil rights movements;
